ReportText: EXAM: CHEST 1 VIEW HISTORY: Shortness of breath. TECHNIQUE: Portable single upright AP view of the chest presented for interpretation. COMPARISON: None. FINDINGS: Heart: Heart magnified by the portable AP technique. Hila: Not enlarged. Mediastinum: Aortic knob atherosclerotic calcification. Lungs: There is mild linear subsegmental atelectasis and/or parenchymal scarring at the lung bases, bilaterally. Pleura: Normal. No definite pleural effusion or pneumothorax is identified radiographically. Other: Cardiac monitor leads and oxygen tubing overlie the chest. The trachea is midline in position. The soft tissues appear intact. Thoracic spine multilevel degenerative joint disease is present. IMPRESSION: Mild bilateral lung base linear subsegmental atelectasis and/or parenchymal scarring. Electronically Signed by: [[PERSONALNAME]] on 06/21/2019 2:28 PM #######################################
